item.title: Helldivers 2 Has a Big Choice to Make When It Comes to ‘Squiddiving’
item.description:
Helldivers 2 has been a haven for Squiddivers for a long while, and not without good reason. The Battle of Super Earth win is remarkably fresh with players having urgently responded to Helldivers 2 ’s Galactic Emergency and, gameplay-wise, it’s been terrific to see the Illuminate threat strengthened while a new map type, Mega Cities, has debuted with epic and cinematic proportions. Plus, not long after the Helldivers avenged Super Earth, the Illuminate were already back to the forefront of democracy’s Galactic War with further Mega City invasions.

Helldivers 2 ’s latest Major Order had players kill 290,000,000 Illuminate and 2,900,000,000 Terminids, and was just recently completed.

It’s unclear how big of an emphasis on squids there will be with whatever is soon to follow this successful MO, but there’d be considerable pros and cons to Helldivers 2 drawing attention away from the Illuminate at this critical moment. It seems as if Squiddivers have finally hit their stride, for instance, with a ton of possibilities for future threats that the squids could provide. Plus, with how warped and disfigured Mega City skyscrapers have become, it would be alarming if their offense suddenly went quiet. However, Botdivers and Bugdivers deserve more love, too, and weapon customization won’t meet its full potential if the Illuminate is constantly obliged.

Helldivers 2’s Squiddivers are Living Their Best Lives Right Now

Squiddivers have been treated wonderfully in the past month with a massive focus on the Illuminate in grand, game-changing events, and Helldivers 2 ’s commemorative Protector of the Heart cape is a lovely memento of Super Earth. That said, there’s a case to be made that the Illuminate’s monopolization of MOs lately should only be the beginning. Players waited patiently for the Illuminate to arrive at Liberty’s doorstep, for instance, and now that they’re here, it would make sense to capitalize on the eerie sci-fi invasion motif it has immersed itself in with dominance in its own sectors.

New Illuminate faction enemy types would be unlikely in the near future since Fleshmobs and Interlopers were just added, yet a continued throughline for the squids could assist in sustaining Squiddivers while Botdivers and Bugdivers receive their fill at a later date. Bots and bugs have already had considerable heydays, to be fair, and squids still have a lot to offer.

Single-Faction Metas Can Undermine Helldivers 2’s Primary Weapon Customization

Rapidly oscillating enemy faction MOs would have a rare benefit provided to them by Helldivers 2 ’s recently launched primary weapon customization. Now, it can be legitimately practical for players to continue equipping and leveling different primary weapons as long as they have various bot, bug, and squid planets to hop between. If one faction is glued to, metas materialize and become unshakable.

Helldivers 2 ’s best Illuminate loadout quite invariably features the R-36 Eruptor Rifle , for example, and while it can be tremendously fun to wield, it can also become stale, like any primary that is cleaved to inseparably, once it’s fully leveled. With some weapons being more effective than others against a particular faction, having a planet to liberate that’s invaded by a faction players haven’t fought in a long time can be refreshing due to the revised loadout they’ll need to consider.

Of course, players are free and encouraged to equip any preferred primary on any mission, as it’ll only affect them and not their squad.

Part of the allure of weapon customization is that players can upgrade and enhance their whole arsenal and not merely one or two primaries, though only having a few guns sitting at level 25 is inevitable if players have already decided what their primary of choice will be for bots, bugs, and squids. Either way, Helldivers 2 indulging in a healthier rotation of faction MOs now would allow for players’ loadouts to be equally dynamic.

item.title: Genshin Impact Reveals How Stygian Onslaught Works
item.description:
Genshin Impact has given players a detailed overview of the Stygian Onslaught, offering tips on how to best approach the new endgame mode in Version 5.7. For the longest time, the endgame in Genshin Impact largely revolved around the Spiral Abyss. Version 4.7 introduced the Imaginarium Theater to the equation, and while a delicate balance was maintained between the two game modes, HoYoverse felt there was room for more.

Version 5.7 saw the debut of the Stygian Onslaught in Genshin Impact , albeit the game mode itself was inspired by previous combat events, such as the Unlimited Fighting Championship from Version 5.5. One thing that makes the Stygian Onslaught stand out from the Imaginarium Theater or the Spiral Abyss is the ability to tackle it in co-op, and the fact that teams start off at zero energy. While Genshnin Impact players have been really excited to test out the former, the latter has received negative feedback even during the beta.

With Stygian Onslaught's release on June 25, 2025, Genshin Impact wanted to give players a crash course on what to expect from the new endgame mode. Perhaps the most important thing to know is that it boasts six levels of difficulty, and players only need to complete the third one to claim all the Primogem rewards. The next two difficulties award a Dust of Enlightenment in Genshin Impact , while the last difficulty awards a unique weapon skin.

Genshin Impact: Stygian Onslaught Overview

For players who want to clear the Dire (VI) difficulty in the Stygian Onslaught, the undertaking requires serious investment in three very specific teams. As such, it is designed to cater to more than just the average player – even featuring a leaderboard system that resets daily. Players who clear the Dire (VI) difficulty can obtain Eminence, and those with the most Eminence can become one of the 16 Exalted Ones, with the leaderboard separated by server. While players can tackle any difficulty in the Stygian Onslaught in co-op mode, the rewards for Fearless (V) and Dire (VI) are restricted to single-player mode. The new endgame mode is located in Liyue in Genshin Impact .

Unlike the other two endgame modes, the Stygian Onslaught allows players to spend Resin in exchange for rewards from a Domain of Blessing – effectively giving players a new way to farm Artifacts in Genshin Impact . However, it should be noted that players will only be able to exchange Resin for rewards in the first 10 days of the challenge and will need to clear the Stygian Onslaught on at least the Hard (III) difficulty. It remains to be seen how the Stygian Onslaught will continue to evolve, but players should keep in mind that their feedback on the new game mode will be extremely valuable in the coming weeks.

Step into Teyvat, a vast world teeming with life and flowing with elemental energy.

You and your sibling arrived here from another world. Separated by an unknown god, stripped of your powers, and cast into a deep slumber, you now awake to a world very different from when you first arrived.

Thus begins your journey across Teyvat to seek answers from The Seven — the gods of each element. Along the way, prepare to explore every inch of this wondrous world, join forces with a diverse range of characters, and unravel the countless mysteries that Teyvat holds...

item.title: Death Stranding 2 is a Must-Play For Fans of This Horror Genre
item.description:
Death Stranding 2: On the Beach takes Sam on another journey centered around connecting humanity, except this time, the story expands beyond the UCA. Venturing into both Mexico and Australia, Death Stranding 2 introduces a variety of fresh environmental hazards and characters to run into. The environmental hazards are harrowing enough to experience, but there is one danger that is even more terrifying: BTs.

BTs are nothing new to Death Stranding 's world, but this time around, they can be a force to be reckoned with. Kojima Productions has introduced a fresh roster of BT types, and they give the game an unexpected horror edge. Death Stranding definitely isn't known for its horror elements, but its sequel leans into the more terrifying aspects of BTs, even entering body horror territory.

Death Stranding 2 Embraces Body Horror for Some of Its Most Terrifying BT Encounters

Death Stranding 2 Comes Out Swinging With its First Boss

Kojima Productions promised more action for Death Stranding 2 , but it's still surprising just how early on the game throws players into its first BT boss battle. This BT run-in happens during the Order 6 level, and when players first get a glimpse at what they're about to fight, it may have some thinking they mistakenly booted up Resident Evil Village instead of Death Stranding 2 .

The BT in question is a giant floating head that splits open to reveal what can only be described as an entrance to Hell itself. It almost looks like Kojima's own take on The Thing . Adorned with tentacle-like appendages that grow out of the head, Death Stranding 2 's first major boss encounter turns the game into a full-blown horror experience for a few moments. That isn't the only way BTs bring some serious body horror energy to the game, though.

There are plenty of emotional moments in Death Stranding 2 , but there is one character backstory that also boasts a touch of horror. A flashback involving Tarman features BTs spilling out of a chiral whale's stomach. The BTs push their way out of the tar-covered mammal, oozing onto a ship's deck. It's borderline gut-churning, but this moment is also just the right amount of body horror to drive home just how otherworldly Death Stranding 2 's BTs really are.

Death Stranding 2 elevates many of the original concepts introduced in the first game. Traversal is easier, thanks to vehicles being given early on, alongside other features like adaptive music, more weapon choices, and even the option to skip boss fights in order to progress through the story faster.

Death Stranding 2's Terrifying BTs Further Prove That Kojima Has Plenty of Horror Potential

  • Hideo Kojima was once tapped by Konami to head the now-canceled Silent Hills .
  • Kojima's iconic PT demo kickstarted a fresh brand of psychologically-chilling horror games.

PT was made as a teaser for the now-defunct Silent Hills . Never getting a Silent Hill game from Kojima is a sad reminder, but the game's cancellation paved the way for Death Stranding to be possible. He may have never gotten the chance to dive into the Silent Hill franchise, but he gets to explore plenty of horror elements with the BTs and their unique designs.

Now that Kojima has been able to experiment with body horror, it will be interesting to see if it influences his upcoming game, OD , in any major way. There isn't much known about OD at the moment, but confirmation that the horror title is being co-written by Jordan Peele is an exciting promise of something wonderfully sinister. Death Stranding 2 may not be a full-blown horror experience, but it can definitely give body horror fans an unexpected way to scratch that specific itch.

item.title: Day-One Xbox Game Pass Game Confirms Jack Black Cameo
item.description:
Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 will feature a Jack Black cameo, Activision has confirmed. The day-one Xbox Game Pass title will see the Hollywood star reprise his role of Officer Dick, in addition to portraying one other character.

Jack Black first played Officer Dick in Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 , released in 2020. Behind-the-scenes footage previously shared by Activision shows the actor recalling how developer Vicarious Visions approached him with the role—an offer he not only accepted but insisted on doing it for free. "I don't want you to pay me anything," he explained, adding that he adores the Tony Hawk's series and never imagined he'd have the chance to appear in one of its games 20 years ago.

Soon enough, Jack Black will find himself in his second Tony Hawk's game to date, with Activision confirming that the upcoming remasters of the third and fourth series entry will see him reprise his role as Officer Dick. Moreover, he'll also get to play another character, Constable Richard, whom Activision just unveiled in a brief Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 video teaser. The new character is essentially a British take on Officer Dick, complete with a traditional custodian helmet.

Officer Dick Has 'Evolved' Between the Last Two Tony Hawk's Games

Jack Black's character in Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 was presented as a school security guard and a bona fide skater hater. "Now he’s evolved, as his power trip has gone into becoming the campus security sheriff of a college," game director Kurt Tillmanns told Variety. In Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 , Officer Dick was unlocked by completing every Create-A-Skater Challenge. The mechanics of unlocking him or his British counterpart in Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 are yet to be disclosed.

Jack Black's involvement in the upcoming remasters continues the long-standing franchise tradition of offbeat, memorable celebrity cameos. Over the years, Tony Hawk's games have featured both real celebs—like Billie Joe Armstrong and Gene Simmons—and famous fictional characters, including Wolverine, Spider-Man, the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and Doom Guy.

Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 is among several titles confirmed to be coming to Xbox Game Pass on day one in July 2025. This group also includes Wheel World , Wuchang: Fallen Feathers , and the Game Preview version of Grounded 2 . Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 is scheduled to launch on July 11. Apart from Microsoft's subscription service, the game will be available as a standalone purchase on the latest two generations of PlayStation, Nintendo, and Xbox consoles, as well as PC.

item.title: Why Space Marine 2 Fans Should Check Out Warhammer 40K: Darktide
item.description:
Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 was one of gaming's most notable success stories in 2024. Releasing roughly 13 years after its predecessor, Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 launched to critical acclaim and has reached 7 million players in less than a year on the market. It was also the recipient of several award nominations at the end of the year, including Best Action Game and Best Multiplayer at The Game Awards 2024, and its predecessor even saw a remastered release on PC and Xbox Series X/S this month.

Publisher Focus Entertainment has taken note of the game’s rousing success, and has recently announced that Warhammer 40:000: Space Marine 3 is in development. With its announcement so closely following the launch of Space Marine 2 , fans may not have to wait another decade for the next installment to release. Still, Space Marine 3 will take its time to cook, and in the meantime, another Warhammer title should tide fans over.

Warhammer 40,000 Fans Have Plenty To Look Forward To

Warhammer 40,000: Darktide Offers A Fresh Take Compared To Space Marine 2

Warhammer fans seeking a new fix alongside Space Marine 2 should consider Warhammer 40,000: Darktide . Released late in 2022, this spiritual successor to the Warhammer: Vermintide sub-series offers co-op, horde-based first-person shooter gameplay with elements akin to a live-service title. This gives the game some fresh flavor from Space Marine 2 , which features third-person gameplay with hack-and-slash elements mixing melee and ranged combat.

Warhammer 40,000: Darktide also differentiates itself from Space Marine 2 in that it’s a multiplayer-focused game. While the latter does feature co-op gameplay, Space Marine 2 ’s main campaign can also be played entirely in single-player. Darktide , meanwhile, offers no solo play option whatsoever, which makes it a great choice for players looking for a new first-person shooter to enjoy with their friends.

Warhammer 40,000: Darktide’s Latest Update Gives Plenty Of Incentive To Jump In

Now is the perfect time to jump back into Warhammer 40,000: Darktide , as developer Fatshark has just released a major new update to the title. Dubbed the “Battle for Terbium” update, this release adds an entirely new class, the Arbites, complete with its own set of new weapons and a support pet known as the Cyber-Mastiff. The new update also features major overhauls to the narrative progression with a new linear campaign, along with a notable reworking of the mission board system, where missions are no longer tethered to certain difficulty levels.

This update has also caused a recent surge in the game’s player count, which reached upwards of 40,000 players on Steam immediately following its release. While those numbers have slowly tailed off, Warhammer 40,000: Darktide still maintains a steady player count of over 20,000 concurrent players, well above the 5,000–10,000 the game had sat at over the last few months. With the game being as populated as it currently is (even without accounting for console players), now feels like the perfect time for newcomers to jump into Darktide .

Now is the perfect time to jump back into Warhammer 40,000: Darktide , as developer Fatshark has just released a major new update to the title.

Warhammer 40,000 Darktide Features Cross-Play For All Platforms

Warhammer 40,000: Darktide also has no platform boundaries, allowing players from different devices to play alongside each other. As the game has expanded to consoles following its initial PC release, Fatshark has added cross-platform play across PC, Xbox, and PlayStation systems. This means Warhammer fans of all kinds will be able to enjoy the game with their friends regardless of their preferred device, and can experience all the update’s new content right out of the gate.

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 has gotten plenty of attention, but Warhammer fans have plenty of options on the market; for example, titles like Warhammer 40,000: Boltgun and Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader showcase the franchise’s ability to cast a wide net and allow different developers to experiment with the property. Warhammer 40,000: Darktide should not be forgotten among the pack, and its new update offers plenty of incentive for new and returning players to jump in.
